summary: This is an email from a NYO CART Coordinator/Senior Forensic Examiner providing a status update on the processing of digital evidence in the Epstein case. It details the number of items processed, ongoing work on servers and DVRs, and exports provided to the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Author of the email providing a status update on the processing of digital evidence (servers, DVRs) from Epstein's properties.

events.title: Digital Evidence Processing Status Update
events.description: A forensic examiner provides a status update on the processing of 55 items of digital evidence from Epstein's properties, noting ongoing work on servers and DVRs and exports of files to the Southern District of New York.
personsInvolved: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: 55 total items of digital evidence were accounted for in the investigation.
2 servers from 'the Island' were still being processed due to mechanical difficulties.
3 DVRs (1 from a NY apartment, 2 from the Island) were being examined by HQ, with data carving attempted to recover deleted files.
Files from 39 items had been exported to the Southern District of New York for review, limited to documents, spreadsheets, emails, and presentations (not images or videos).
The email indicates an active, technical forensic investigation into Epstein's digital records was ongoing as of July 2020.
